abstract: The beleaguered insurer American International Group has agreed to suspend payments to executives from a $600 million bonus fund as well as $19 million in payments to its former chief executive, New York’s attorney general announced Wednesday, The New York Times’s Jonathan D. Glater reports.
lead_paragraph: The beleaguered insurer American International Group has agreed to suspend payments to executives from a $600 million bonus fund as well as $19 million in payments to its former chief executive, New York’s attorney general announced Wednesday, The New York Times’s Jonathan D. Glater reports.

headline.main: A.I.G. to Suspend Millions in Executive Payments.
